Code for Boston

Every Tuesday, 7-10 pm
Cambridge Innovation Center
Cambridge, MA

Come Hang Out!

Get involved with Code For Boston

Code for Boston aims to provide a ‘center of gravity’ for grassroots, community-driven civic innovation in the Greater Boston area. Our work includes building apps, community organizing, policy initiatives, qualitative research, and more, and we hope that volunteers of all types will join our community. We can’t wait to meet you.

Jam on Civic
Tech Projects

All of our projects are open source and freely available on Github. Hit it up if you’re a developer or designer. We love pull requests!

Get Started

Chat with Code for Boston Members

We use Hackpad to collaborate on our projects, organize our thoughts, and plan civic innovation events. Feel free to simply browse our discussions, or jump in and contribute to the conversation!

Come Hang Out

Learn more
about Civic Tech

Civic innovation is a wonderful way to make a difference and give back to your community. But, it can also be a confusing place full of unfamiliar names and acronyms. We can help you get started.

Learn More
  • Code For Boston
  • hello@codeforboston.org
  • GitHub: codeforboston
  • Twitter: @codeforboston
  • Hackpad
  • Meetup

Part of the Code for America Brigade network, we are a volunteer group of developers, designers, data geeks, and citizen activists who use creative technology to solve civic and social problems.
